analyzed: gang gi sgra ni sngar ba shad pa'i skyon sdud par byed pa'i don can yin no //

analyzed: gang gi tshe tshad mas de lta bu'i ngo bor sgrub ba zhes bya ba la @263b sogs pa la /
translated: “When valid cognition establishes such an entity” and so on.

original: gal te gang gi ched du gtan tshigs smos pa de de lta bu'i ngo bo tshad ma gzhan gyis sgrub pa de'i tshe de la de lta bu'i ngo bo'i yul can gzhan sgrub par mi byed pa nyid kyis las bya ba bsgrub pa can bsgrub pa nyid du🔽mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gang gi ched du gtan tshigs smos pa de de lta bu'i ngo bo tshad ma gzhan gyis sgrub pa de'i tshe de la de lta bu'i ngo bo'i yul can gzhan sgrub par mi byed pa nyid kyis las bya ba bsgrub pa can bsgrub pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the reason is stated for the sake of establishing that such an entity is established by another valid cognition, then at that time, since it does not establish the object of such an entity, it is not suitable to be a proof that establishes the object of action.

original: gang gi tshe gnod pa can gyi tshad mas de lta bu'i ngo bo 'gog pa de'i tshe yang gzhan de lta bu'i ngo bo'i yul sgrub par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnod pa can gyi tshad mas de lta bu'i ngo bo 'gog pa de'i tshe yang gzhan de lta bu'i ngo bo'i yul sgrub par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When a valid cognition that contradicts it refutes such an entity, then at that time, it does not become an establishment of another object of such an entity.

original: dngos po la tshul gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir tshad ma 'gal ba dag ni de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bor nges pa'am /

translated: Because it is not possible for a thing to have two modes, the two contradictory valid cognitions do not engage it.🔽Therefore, it would be ascertained as having such an essence,

original: de lta bu'i ngo bor 'gog pa gnod pa can nam /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bor 'gog pa gnod pa can nam /
translated: or it would be refuted as having such an essence,

original: gnod pa med pa'i tshad ma la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i tshad ma la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: without depending on a valid cognition that is either undermined or nondeceptive.

original: gzhan dag gang gi tshe tshad mas de lta bu ma yin pa'i ngo bor bsgrub pa zhes 'dren pa de'i yang don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gang gi tshe tshad mas de lta bu ma yin pa'i ngo bor bsgrub pa zhes 'dren pa de'i yang don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Others say that when it is said, “A valid cognition establishes it as not having such an essence,” the meaning of that is as follows.🔽A valid cognition that is undermined refutes it as not having such an essence,

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad mas de lta bu'i ngo bo ma yin pas bsgrub pa'am /🔽sgrub par byed pas 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad mas de lta bu'i ngo bo ma yin pas bsgrub pa'am / sgrub par byed pas 'gog pa yin te /
translated: or a valid cognition that is nondeceptive establishes it as not having such an essence.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo ma yin pa bkag pa na de lta bu'i ngo bo bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo ma yin pa bkag pa na de lta bu'i ngo bo bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is refuted as not having such an essence, it is established as having such an essence.

original: gzhung phyi ma ni ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung phyi ma ni ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The latter passage should be applied as appropriate.

original: de'i tshe yul can gtan tshigs kyang mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni yul med par yul can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yul can gtan tshigs kyang mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni yul med par yul can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the subject, the reason, does not engage it. This is because without an object, a subject is not possible.

original: yul can med na yang phyogs kyi tshig 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul can med na yang phyogs kyi tshig 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If there is no subject, then there is not even the mere expression of a position,

original: phyogs kyi tshigs ni gtan tshigs kyi yul bstan pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi tshigs ni gtan tshigs kyi yul bstan pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the expression of a position is for the purpose of indicating the locus of the reason.

original: de dag kyang slob dpon gyis rigs pa'i 'dod pa la brten nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang slob dpon gyis rigs pa'i 'dod pa la brten nas bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni yul rab ru bstan du yang phyogs kyi tshig brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But in reality, the expression of a position is not to be used to indicate the locus,

analyzed: dper na gzhan dag tu bstan pa lta bu'o // de de ltar na gtan tshigs la phyogs ltar snang ba yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: just as it is not used in other contexts.🔽Thus, the reason does not have a position that is a mere appearance of a position,

original: sbyor ba 'ba' zhig yin pa de ltar na phyogs ltar snang ba brjod pa 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'ba' zhig yin pa de ltar na phyogs ltar snang ba brjod pa 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: and so the expression of a mere appearance of a position is fruitless.

original: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum yin pas zhes bya ba la rjes su dpag pa gcig ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin la gzhan ni yid ches pa'i tshig dang rang gi tshig gi bdag nyid khas blangs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum yin pas zhes bya ba la rjes su dpag pa gcig ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin la gzhan ni yid ches pa'i tshig dang rang gi tshig gi bdag nyid khas blangs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: one type of inference is based on the power of fact, and the other two are based on the expressions of statements of trustworthy persons and one’s own statements.

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mdor yid ches pa'i sgras bstan pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan rab tu grags pa'i sgras brjod pa yin pa de bas na rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mdor yid ches pa'i sgras bstan pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan rab tu grags pa'i sgras brjod pa yin pa de bas na rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the Compendium of Valid Knowledge, the statements of trustworthy persons are taught, and the other is expressed by the term “well known.” Therefore, there are three types.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yid ches pa dang / rang gi tshig gcig tu byas pas rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa rnam pa gsum dang / @264a * //
translated: Therefore, since the statements of trustworthy persons and one’s own statements are made into one, there are four types of inference: the three types of inference that are undermined and

original: mngon sum gyi gnod pa dang bcas pa ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gnod pa dang bcas pa ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: that which is undermined by direct perception.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i tshig dang / rang gi tshig dang 'jig rten la grags pa ste 'gal ba rnam pa bzhi dang / mngon sum gyi 'gal ba gcig ste de ltar na rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i tshig dang / rang gi tshig dang 'jig rten la grags pa ste 'gal ba rnam pa bzhi dang / mngon sum gyi 'gal ba gcig ste de ltar na rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, there would be four kinds of contradiction with inference based on the power of fact, with authoritative statements, with one’s own words, and with what is commonly recognized in the world, and one more kind of contradiction with direct perception.

original: dper na rigs pa'i sgor rnam par bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rigs pa'i sgor rnam par bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is explained in the Gate for Entering the Dharma Door of Valid Cognition.

original: 'dir yang 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa'i t'i k'a byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa'i t'i k'a byed pa dag ste /
translated: Here, “some” refers to the authors of the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: de dag ni tshig gsum zlas dbye ba byas nas rab tu grags pa'i sgra dang / gsum pa'i de'i skyes bur khas len cing grags pa'i sgra yang re re la mngon par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni tshig gsum zlas dbye ba byas nas rab tu grags pa'i sgra dang / gsum pa'i de'i skyes bur khas len cing grags pa'i sgra yang re re la mngon par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They make a threefold division of words and apply the words “well known” and “accepted by the person” to each of the three.

original: yang dag nges zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag nges zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: “Correctly ascertained” means knowing the meaning as it is.

original: ldan pa'i sgra ni 'jug pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa'i sgra ni 'jug pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The word “endowed” is a term of engagement.

original: skad kyi byings don sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad kyi byings don sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meanings of the verbal roots are various.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs gzhan gyi tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes na 'jug pa'i ngag gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs gzhan gyi tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes na 'jug pa'i ngag gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “If one understands the meaning as it is, one should analyze the sentence as follows: ‘That which has speech that engages in that way.’”

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can du khas len pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang ldan pa'i ngag ni khas blangs pa'i dbang gis de dag tshad mar gyur ba yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can du khas len pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang ldan pa'i ngag ni khas blangs pa'i dbang gis de dag tshad mar gyur ba yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar
translated: “One who accepts that kind of speech” means that speech endowed with the understanding of the meaning as it is is valid because of the acceptance of that, but not because of the power of the thing itself.🔽This is the intention.

original: dgongs so // de bas na de'i bstan bcos la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rten par byed pas na brten pa ste bstan bcos khas len pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgongs so // de bas na de'i bstan bcos la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rten par byed pas na brten pa ste bstan bcos khas len pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, “based on that treatise” means that it is based because it is dependent, and the meaning is that it accepts the treatise.

original: tshad ma med pa'i dam bca' ba de bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i dam bca' ba de bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug go //
translated: “The assertion that is without a valid means of knowledge is refuted” is the conclusion.

original: de bas na nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i yul can dag kyang de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa zhes bya ba la don byed ba la mi slu ba'i sgo nas shes pa gang dag la yul nyams su myong ba med pa de dag kyang nyams su
analyzed: de bas na nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i yul can dag kyang de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa zhes bya ba la don byed ba la mi slu ba'i sgo nas shes pa gang dag la yul nyams su myong ba med pa de dag kyang nyams su
translated: Therefore, even those subjects that do not experience objects are said to have that nature. Those cognitions that are nondeceptive with regard to the performance of action, even though they do not experience objects,

original: myong ba ma yin pa'i yul can gyi shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can de mi slu ba nyid dang tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myong ba ma yin pa'i yul can gyi shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can de mi slu ba nyid dang tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: are like cognitions that have objects that are not experienced. Therefore, they have that nature. The words “nondeceptive” and “valid cognition” have the same meaning.

original: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: “ Future” means future arising.

original: chos ni chos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni chos la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Phenomena” means such things as phenomena.

original: bde mi 'byin zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'di la chos zhes bya ba'i chos can bstan bcos la grags pa yin te /
analyzed: bde mi 'byin zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'di la chos zhes bya ba'i chos can bstan bcos la grags pa yin te /
translated: In this probandum, “do not produce pleasure,” the term “phenomena” is a property of the subject that is well known in treatises,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception and the other means of valid knowledge do not engage it.

original: rang bzhin gyi bskal ba'i phyir dang / de med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bskal ba'i phyir dang / de med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a natural period, and because there is no definite reason for it to occur when it does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe bstan @264b bcos pa zhes bya ba la 'di la bstan bcos yod pas na bstan bcos pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bstan @264b bcos pa zhes bya ba la 'di la bstan bcos yod pas na bstan bcos pa ste /
translated: When it is said, “the treatise-holder,” it is because he has a treatise.

original: de'i tshe khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it is because of the acceptance.

original: de nyid ni bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That very thing is stated in “the treatise called,” and so on.

original: dmigs par byed pas na dmigs pa ste brten pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pas na dmigs pa ste brten pa'o //
translated: It is a basis because it is a support.

original: dngos su bstan bcos de la dmigs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su bstan bcos de la dmigs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has a basis in the treatise is called that.

original: de la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa ni de dmigs can min te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa ni de dmigs can min te /
translated: That which does not have a basis in it is not a basis in it.

original: bstan bcos la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not a support for the treatise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos kyis ma bstan pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos kyis ma bstan pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That is why it is said, “not taught in the treatise as accepted.”

original: ji ltar khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos kyis ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos kyis ma bstan pa ste /
translated: Not taught in the treatise as accepted.

original: tshad ma gzhan nyid kyis grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan nyid kyis grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is established by another valid cognition.

original: bstan bcos des ma nges pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi dbang gis sgra nges pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyi tshad kyi las yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos des ma nges pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi dbang gis sgra nges pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyi tshad kyi las yin no //
translated: The treatise says, “The subject is not ascertained,” meaning that the word is not ascertained by the power of the treatise, but rather by the operation of the valid cognition of perception.

original: gal te yang dpyod pa pas bstan bcos tshad ma nyid du khas len pa de lta na yang 'di dag ni tshig tsam du bye brag med pa'i phyir phan tshun gags byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te yang dpyod pa pas bstan bcos tshad ma nyid du khas len pa de lta na yang 'di dag ni tshig tsam du bye brag med pa'i phyir phan tshun gags byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even if the investigator accepts the treatise as valid, since these are mere words, they are not distinguished from each other.

original: nus pa mtshungs phyir zhes bya ba ni stobs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa mtshungs phyir zhes bya ba ni stobs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Because of equal potency” means because of equal strength.

original: sgra rtag ces bya ba'i bstan bcos kyi ngag 'di la yang stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyi tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra rtag ces bya ba'i bstan bcos kyi ngag 'di la yang stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyi tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This statement of the treatise “Sound is permanent” has not the slightest valid cognition of power.

original: rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa can ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa can ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that the thesis of permanence is not undermined, because it is not a valid cognition.

original: byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag go zhes bshad pa tshad ma dang ldan pa de rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba la gnod pa can yin pa de bas na de dag nus pa mtshungs pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag go zhes bshad pa tshad ma dang ldan pa de rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba la gnod pa can yin pa de bas na de dag nus pa mtshungs pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: The explanation that “it is impermanent because it is produced” is endowed with valid cognition. It undermines the thesis of permanence. Therefore, they are similar in their ability.

original: de ni bden te 'di ltar de dag tshig gnyis po dag gi nang nas tshig gcig la tshad ma yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bden te 'di ltar de dag tshig gnyis po dag gi nang nas tshig gcig la tshad ma yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is true. It is like this. Among the two statements, the statement “one has valid cognition” and so on will be explained immediately below.

original: dpe'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod pa yin te gzhan du gang la bstan bcos dang cig shos gnyi ga dag kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i dpe nye bar bkod ba yin no //
analyzed: dpe'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di nye bar bkod pa yin te gzhan du gang la bstan bcos dang cig shos gnyi ga dag kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i dpe nye bar bkod ba yin no //
translated: This is presented as an example. In other cases, both the treatise and the other are presented as examples that are not valid cognitions.

original: gang la yang bstan bcos la nye bar bstan pa ni chos can yin te /
analyzed: gang la yang bstan bcos la nye bar bstan pa ni chos can yin te /
translated: In any case, what is presented in the treatise is the subject.

original: dper na ma 'ongs par bde ba 'byin par byed pa ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya ba de la yang bstan bcos dang / cig shos dag ni dam bca' ba tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gags byed pa nyid rigs pa yin gyi gnod pa byed pa ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: dper na ma 'ongs par bde ba 'byin par byed pa ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya ba de la yang bstan bcos dang / cig shos dag ni dam bca' ba tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gags byed pa nyid rigs pa yin gyi gnod pa byed pa ni ma yin nam /
translated: For example, in the case of the so-called phenomenon that does not produce pleasure in the future, it is reasonable that the treatise and the other are obstacles because they are not valid cognitions, but they are not harmful.

original: de bas na @265a * //
analyzed: de bas na @265a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: dngos po de la dmigs pa can ma yin pa zhes bye brag brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po de la dmigs pa can ma yin pa zhes bye brag brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not to be said that the object of that is not observed.

original: 'di snyam du chos can rnam par gzhag pa ni bstan bcos la brten pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dpyod pa'i skabs kyi bstan bcos rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa de ltar na bstan bcos kyi ngag la stobs dang ldan pa nyid yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so
analyzed: 'di snyam du chos can rnam par gzhag pa ni bstan bcos la brten pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dpyod pa'i skabs kyi bstan bcos rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa de ltar na bstan bcos kyi ngag la stobs dang ldan pa nyid yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so
translated: It is thought that since the presentation of the subject depends on the treatise, the treatise is the reason for the analysis, and thus the words of the treatise have great power.

original: // de'i tshe de dag las tshig gcig la tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya la sogs pa la bstan bcos kyi ngag gang yin pa dang / tshig gang gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba de dag ni gcig la tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: // de'i tshe de dag las tshig gcig la tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya la sogs pa la bstan bcos kyi ngag gang yin pa dang / tshig gang gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba de dag ni gcig la tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: At that time, among those, the words “not having valid cognition” and so on, whatever the words of the treatise are, and whatever the words that contradict them, those are the words that contradict the single one that has valid cognition.

original: tshad ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “devoid of valid cognition.”

original: tshad ma dang ldan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bstan bcos la ltos pa'i tshig tshad ma dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma dang ldan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bstan bcos la ltos pa'i tshig tshad ma dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “If it has valid cognition” means when the words that rely on the treatise become endowed with valid cognition.

original: dper na dpyod pa pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag go zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dpyod pa pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag go zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like when a philosopher says, “It is impermanent because it is produced.”

original: bstan pas tha dad pa ste so sor byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pas tha dad pa ste so sor byas pa yin no //
translated: It is taught separately, that is, individually.

original: de la rgya bstan bcos gang yang rung ba'i tshig chad ma nyid ma yin pa na yang gnod pa byed pa nyid yin par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rgya bstan bcos gang yang rung ba'i tshig chad ma nyid ma yin pa na yang gnod pa byed pa nyid yin par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, whatever the words of any treatise are, even if they are not complete, it is asserted that they are harmful.

original: bstan bcos kyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i tshig de nyid kyi ming ste ming can gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i tshig de nyid kyi ming ste ming can gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the name of the treatise, which is one part of the treatise, is called a treatise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of that alone means because of the absence of reasoning.

original: 'dis ni tshig gcig ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshig gcig ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that one statement is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: tshad ma dang ldan pa yin na zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni tshig gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: tshad ma dang ldan pa yin na zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni tshig gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That which was explained as if it is a valid means of knowledge, he explains with in one statement, etc.

original: gnod pa byed pa ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: A valid means of knowledge is that which is not contradicted.

original: de yang rtogs pa po khas len pa'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa po khas len pa'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: And that is due to the power of the one who understands accepting it.🔽And that has already been analyzed in the section beginning with

original: de yang / de la khas blangs 'bras rtags dang // zhes bya ba'i skabs su dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de yang / de la khas blangs 'bras rtags dang // zhes bya ba'i skabs su dpyad zin to //
translated: If one says that the reason is the effect of that,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid ma yin pa la tshad ma nyid du zhes blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid ma yin pa la tshad ma nyid du zhes blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should understand that it is not a direct perception, but is a valid means of knowledge.

original: mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma thams cad rjes su dpag pa'i nad du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma thams cad rjes su dpag pa'i nad du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all valid cognitions other than perception are included within inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa yin par brjod de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa yin par brjod de /
translated: And because it is the cause of inference, it is said to be outside of inference.

original: bstan bcos kyis kun nas slong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i bstan bcos 'bras bu'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyis kun nas slong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i bstan bcos 'bras bu'i rtags yin no //
translated: The treatise is the effect of the inference that is motivated by the treatise, and it is the reason for that inference.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i tshig yul gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa kas blangs pas zhes bya ba ni lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i tshig yul gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa kas blangs pas zhes bya ba ni lnga pa yin no //
translated: If it is said that the word “different” in the statement “different objects” and so on is the fifth case, the ablative,

original: @265b gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i yul tha dad pa bstan pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba las tha dad pa'i tshig ni khas blangs pa'i skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ltos par bya ba yin pa'am khas blangs pas gnod pa las bya ba'i
analyzed: @265b gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i yul tha dad pa bstan pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba las tha dad pa'i tshig ni khas blangs pa'i skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ltos par bya ba yin pa'am khas blangs pas gnod pa las bya ba'i
translated: then the word “different” in the statement “different from what is contradictory to inference” is the sixth case, the ablative of separation, because it is the object of the statement of the different objects as they have been explained.

original: tshig de nyid drug pa rnam par bsgyur la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig de nyid drug pa rnam par bsgyur la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the word “different” should be applied in the transformed sixth case.

original: rang gi tshig kyang tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i mdo la drug pa'i don gyi bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi tshig kyang tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i mdo la drug pa'i don gyi bdun pa yin no //
translated: Also, in the sutra called Different Words, the seventh case is used for the sixth case.

original: rang gi tshig ni rigs pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ste so sor byas pa yin no /
analyzed: rang gi tshig ni rigs pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ste so sor byas pa yin no /
translated: The word different means that the words are different in kind, that is, they are made separately.

original: la rgyu ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: la rgyu ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reason is as follows.

original: tshig tu brjod pa tsam la rag las pa nyid ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nyid ni rang gi tshig kyang tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa tsam la rag las pa nyid ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nyid ni rang gi tshig kyang tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do
translated: In order to show that the mere dependence on verbal expression is not a fault, he explains with Different words, etc.

original: // gags byed ba 'ba' zhig kho nar 'gyur gyi gnod pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: // gags byed ba 'ba' zhig kho nar 'gyur gyi gnod pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only an obstruction, not a fault.

original: bstan bcos la brten pa'i chos can ni rnam par dpyod pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos sgrub par byed pa yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten pa'i chos can ni rnam par dpyod pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos sgrub par byed pa yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the subject based on the treatise is the basis for analysis, it would also be established by the treatise.

original: de bas na tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, he thinks, There is a reason for the difference.

original: rang gi tshig de dag kyang rtag tu gags byed pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na de la de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi tshig de dag kyang rtag tu gags byed pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na de la de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And his own words are not always obstructive. Thus he says, “In that case, those words . . .”

original: gang gi tshe gcig tshad ma dang ldan pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i don gcig ston par byed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig tshad ma dang ldan pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i don gcig ston par byed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: “A single word possessing a valid cognition” means a word that reveals the meaning of a single thesis.

original: gal te tshad ma dang ldan par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma dang ldan par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it possesses a valid cognition, that is the meaning of “if it were to be . . .”

original: de'i tshe yang tshad ma'i stobs kyi gnod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang tshad ma'i stobs kyi gnod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it is obstructive by the power of the valid cognition.

original: ji ltar rigs par de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin gyi rang gi tshig gis gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin gyi rang gi tshig gis gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is obstructive by direct perception and inference, as is appropriate, but it is not obstructive by its own words.🔽“If it were to be obstructive, . . .” means “if it were to be obstructive by the power of a valid cognition.”

original: gal te bstan bcos tshad ma nyid yin par khas len pa'i phyir gnod pa byed par skyes pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir de las gnod pa byed pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos tshad ma nyid yin par khas len pa'i phyir gnod pa byed par skyes pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir de las gnod pa byed pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
translated: “Because the treatise is accepted as being a valid cognition” means “because it is accepted as a valid cognition, the obstruction arises from that.” This is the meaning of the passage.

original: de yang yin la lung yang yin pas na lung de'o //
analyzed: de yang yin la lung yang yin pas na lung de'o //
translated: It is a scripture, and it is that, therefore it is that scripture.

original: de mi 'dod na ni bstan bcos gnod pa byed pa yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs la ltos nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mi 'dod na ni bstan bcos gnod pa byed pa yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs la ltos nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not accept that, then the treatise would not be able to harm.

original: 'o na de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di byung bar bya'o //🔽gal te sngar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di byung bar bya'o // gal te sngar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: Now, if that is so, etc. This is to be brought up in the context of the passage.🔽If previously, etc. is a response to the doubt of the opponent.

original: snga ma des zhes bya ba ni sngar de dang por bstan bcos khas blangs pa rten pas so //
analyzed: snga ma des zhes bya ba ni sngar de dang por bstan bcos khas blangs pa rten pas so //
translated: The former, etc. means that previously, by accepting the treatise, one would rely on it.

original: tshig phyi ma la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos khas mi len pa'i'o //
analyzed: tshig phyi ma la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos khas mi len pa'i'o //
translated: The latter, etc. means that one would not accept the treatise.

original: 'o na de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar bstan bcos kyang rgol bas khas blangs pa nyid las @266a * //
analyzed: 'o na de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar bstan bcos kyang rgol bas khas blangs pa nyid las @266a * //
translated: Now, if that is so, etc. This is to be brought up in the context of the passage.

original: tshad ma yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis ma yin pa de ltar na gal te rang gi tshig kyang yin pa de ltar na 'di dag la tha dad pa ni ci zhig yod /
analyzed: tshad ma yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis ma yin pa de ltar na gal te rang gi tshig kyang yin pa de ltar na 'di dag la tha dad pa ni ci zhig yod /
translated: It is a valid cognition, but not one based on the power of the fact. In that case, if it is your own statement, then what is the difference between them?🔽As it was previously explained.

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said:

original: bdag gzhan yid ches 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: bdag gzhan yid ches 'dod pa yin //
translated: “One’s own mind and the minds of others are to be trusted and desired.”🔽What is it like?

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: It is said:

original: yang dag nges dang ldan pa'i ngag /
analyzed: yang dag nges dang ldan pa'i ngag /
translated: “Speech endowed with perfect ascertainment.”

original: ces bya ba'i skabs su bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i skabs su bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained in the section on “ascertainment.”

original: gal te rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las bstan bcos kyi 'gal ba tha dad pa la skyon ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las bstan bcos kyi 'gal ba tha dad pa la skyon ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If there is no difference between contradiction of one’s own statement and contradiction of a treatise, what is the problem?

original: de ltar na gags byed pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na gags byed pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, it is said: “In that case, it would be a hindrance.”

original: rang gi tshig dang 'dra bar bstan bcos gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'dra bar bstan bcos gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that a treatise is not like one’s own statement, which is not a hindrance.

original: rab grags don dag la zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni gang gi tshe chos can dang rtags yin par zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rab grags don dag la zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni gang gi tshe chos can dang rtags yin par zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on this very verse, “When the subject and reason are renowned in the world,” is “when the subject and reason are renowned in the world.”

original: de yang don dam par rtogs pa'i rten ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni lung ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang don dam par rtogs pa'i rten ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni lung ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //

analyzed: grub pa'i dbang gis ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i drug pa grub pa ma yin la / rigs kyi sgra gzhi mthun pa las rigs ni rdzas las tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: And in the case of such expressions as “cowness,” the application of the sixth case ending does not establish the existence of something separate from the cow.🔽In the case of such expressions as “the universal of cow,” the application of the term “universal” does not establish the nondifference of the universal from the substance.

original: rigs med pa nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs med pa nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: And in the case of such expressions as “the universal of non-cow,” the application of the term “universal” does not establish the difference of the universal from the substance.

original: shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gcig pa'i sbyor ba las yan lag can gcig grub pa ma yin zhing tshig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las kyang du ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gcig pa'i sbyor ba las yan lag can gcig grub pa ma yin zhing tshig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las kyang du ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the case of such expressions as “the tree,” the application of a single term does not establish the existence of a whole. And in the case of such expressions as “the branches of the tree,” the application of a second term and so on does not establish the existence of a plurality.

original: sgra tsam las grub pa nyid yin na ni thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra tsam las grub pa nyid yin na ni thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If mere words established the existence of something, then everything would establish the existence of everything.

original: zla ba gcig yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pa'i gzhung 'god pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gcig yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rigs pa'i sgo'i t'i k'a byed pa'i gzhung 'god pa yin no //
translated: The statement “because of the existence of one month” and so on is the statement of the treatise of the Tarka-sāstra.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang grags pa dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang grags pa dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: And the contradiction with that is the contradiction with what is well known.

original: de ltar da trig shing min zhes //
analyzed: de ltar da trig shing min zhes //
translated: Thus, “it is not a dhatki tree”

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo yin la 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni da trig shing ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo yin la 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni da trig shing ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the sūtra, and the commentary on it is “it is not a dhatki tree.”

original: de bas na de dngos su grub pa yin na ri bong can la yang zla ba nyid yod pa zhes bya ba la gal te zla ba nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ri bong can du khas len par byed na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na de dngos su grub pa yin na ri bong can la yang zla ba nyid yod pa zhes bya ba la gal te zla ba nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ri bong can du khas len par byed na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, if that is established, then it is as follows: “Even in the case of the rabbit-bearer, there is the existence of moon-ness.” If one accepts the thing that is the reason for moon-ness in the rabbit-bearer, that is what is intended.

original: grags pa zhes bya ba'i rjes dpog ces bya ba ni 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can gyi grags pa 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa gang yin pa 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: grags pa zhes bya ba'i rjes dpog ces bya ba ni 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can gyi grags pa 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa gang yin pa 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: “What is called ‘well known’ is inference” means that what is well known, which is related to mere desire, is established as the mere object of expression by the word “desire.”

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyi rtags las 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba thams cad la yod pa'i chos rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyi rtags las 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba thams cad la yod pa'i chos rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the reason of intrinsic nature, the property that exists in all that is expressed by the word desire is to be inferred.

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa ni 'dir rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa ni 'dir rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: The cognition that has that as its object is the inference here.

original: shes pa de nyid brgyud pas @268a * //
analyzed: shes pa de nyid brgyud pas @268a * //
translated: That cognition itself is indirectly

original: grags pas byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grags pas byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: made by the well-known,

original: grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes brgyud pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes brgyud pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: therefore it is taught indirectly as inference by renown.

original: brda 'gog med la skyes pa yi //
analyzed: brda 'gog med la skyes pa yi //
translated: For one born in a place without the convention,

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni brda tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni brda tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, being expressed by the word desire is merely related to convention.

original: de bas na 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir thams cad du srid pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir thams cad du srid pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is merely related to desire, it is possible everywhere.

original: don 'di nyid ni sbyor bas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni sbyor bas gsal bar byed do //
translated: This very meaning is clarified by the syllogism.

original: dang po'i don la brdar byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs brjod pas rdzas la 'jug pa de bas na rigs dang po'i don yin te der yang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'dod rgyal gyi sgrar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po'i don la brdar byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs brjod pas rdzas la 'jug pa de bas na rigs dang po'i don yin te der yang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'dod rgyal gyi sgrar 'gyur ro //
translated: The first meaning is the one that is conventionally applied, and since the term “genus” is used to refer to a substance, it is the first meaning of the term “genus.”  Moreover, since it does not depend on another reason, it is a term of chance.

original: khas blangs pa dang grags pas gnod pa dag ces bya ba'i tshig gnyis pa ni rang gi tshig dang yid ches pa'i tshig gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang grags pas gnod pa dag ces bya ba'i tshig gnyis pa ni rang gi tshig dang yid ches pa'i tshig gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two terms “contradicted by what is asserted” and “contradicted by what is commonly held” are taken as a single term, “what is commonly held.”

original: de dag gnod pa gnyis po'i zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa dang grags pas gnod pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gnod pa gnyis po'i zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa dang grags pas gnod pa dag gi'o //
translated: “By these two contradictions” refers to contradiction by what is asserted and contradiction by what is commonly held.

original: dper na gzhal bya'i don can dag gi tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung 'god pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na gzhal bya'i don can dag gi tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung 'god pa yin no //
translated: For example, the text of the Compendium of Valid Knowledge states, “The valid knowledge of those who have objects to be cognized,” and so on.

original: dam bca' ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni skabs la brten pa nyid kyi bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag rgol bas tshad ma nyid du dam bcas pa de tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam bca' ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni skabs la brten pa nyid kyi bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag rgol bas tshad ma nyid du dam bcas pa de tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase merely by the assertion means that the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition merely by the opponent's assertion that they are valid cognition.

original: de nyid ni bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //🔽gal te yang rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar don la mi slu ba'i rtags kyis tshad ma nyid du grub pa de ltar na rjes su dpag pa grub pa nyid kyi phyir gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do // gal te yang rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar don la mi slu ba'i rtags kyis tshad ma nyid du grub pa de ltar na rjes su dpag pa grub pa nyid kyi phyir gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is explained by the phrase the treatise and the words of the author, and so on.🔽If it is said that the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then it is replied: If the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then the opponent's inference is established by the mere assertion of the opponent.

original: de bzhin du yid ches pas gnod pa rgyu dang bcas pa ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid ches pas gnod pa rgyu dang bcas pa ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis bstan to //
translated: If it is said that the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then it is replied: If the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then the opponent's inference is established by the mere assertion of the opponent.🔽If it is said that the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then it is replied: If the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then the opponent's inference is established by the mere assertion of the opponent.🔽If it is said that the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then it is replied: If the treatise and the words of the author are established as valid cognition by the mere assertion of the opponent, then the opponent's inference is established by the mere assertion of the opponent.

original: 'di la gnyis yod pa ni ma yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis yod pa ni ma yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Since there are not two of these, i.e., particular and universal characteristics, it is a particular characteristic.

original: mngon sum don zhes bya ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum don zhes bya ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase in this regard, direct perception is the object refers to the following.

original: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mdo 'di la'o //
analyzed: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i mdo 'di la'o //
translated: In this sutra, the Compendium of Valid Knowledge, it is said, Direct perception, inference, and testimony.

original: rna ba'i dbang po yul nyid du zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid nyid do //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po yul nyid du zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid nyid do //
translated: The phrase the ear is the object refers to the particular characteristic of sound.

original: 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba sgra rang gi mtshan nyid rna ba'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir mnyan pa yin la /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba sgra rang gi mtshan nyid rna ba'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir mnyan pa yin la /
translated: Sound, which is to be grasped by auditory consciousness, is the object of the ear because it is the particular characteristic of sound.

original: des kyang @268b mnyan par bya ba ma yin par dam bca' ba bstsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des kyang @268b mnyan par bya ba ma yin par dam bca' ba bstsal ba yin no //
translated: And by that, the thesis that it is not to be heard is refuted.

original: de yang mngon sum nyid kyis nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum nyid kyis nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin gyi /
translated: And since that is ascertained by direct perception itself, it is contradicted by direct perception.

original: rna ba dang sgra dag ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'i sgra'i don mnyan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang sgra dag ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'i sgra'i don mnyan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Sound and the ear are not the meaning of the word to be heard, which is related by the characteristic of the object apprehended and the subject.

original: de bas na gsal byed pa la sogs pa dag gis sgra mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa yin te 'brel pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na gsal byed pa la sogs pa dag gis sgra mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa yin te 'brel pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement that sound is not to be heard by the articulators, etc., is invalidated by inference, because the relation is denied.

original: de ltar na rna ba dang sgra dag gis 'brel pa mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa de ltar na de ni sgra'i don mi shes pa dag gis brjod pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rna ba dang sgra dag gis 'brel pa mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa de ltar na de ni sgra'i don mi shes pa dag gis brjod pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, if the relation of sound and the ear is to be understood by perception, then it should be understood that this is stated by those who do not understand the meaning of the word.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir rna ba dang lhan cig sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir rna ba dang lhan cig sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “Sound together with the ear,” and so on.

original: grub pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grub pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “That which is established as such a nature” means “that which is established as its own nature.”

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //🔽de'i stobs kyis grub pa'i dngos po ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i shugs nyid las grub pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid do // de'i stobs kyis grub pa'i dngos po ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i shugs nyid las grub pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: “That” refers to the intrinsic identity of sound.🔽The thing that is established by the force of that is the thing that is established by the force of the auditory consciousness itself.

original: rang gi chos can zhes bya ba de zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus par rang gi chos can zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos can zhes bya ba de zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus par rang gi chos can zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Its subject” refers to “its subject” in the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: de bas na gnod pa smos pas zhes bya ba ni chos la gnod pa smos pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bas na gnod pa smos pas zhes bya ba ni chos la gnod pa smos pas kyang ngo //
translated: “Therefore, by mentioning the refutation” refers to mentioning the refutation of the property.

original: mkha' sogs min zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' sogs min zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'o //
translated: “Not space, etc.” indicates the subject.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on this is “space, etc.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyogs dang dus la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyogs dang dus la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term “etc.” includes direction, time, etc.🔽For example:

original: dper / sngon med ngo bo gzhan gyis bskyed bya min //
analyzed: dper / sngon med ngo bo gzhan gyis bskyed bya min //
translated: It is not produced by another, a non-existent entity.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'chad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the property to be proven.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of this is “the conditions that are co-present causes, etc.”

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam par gcod pa tsam yin gyi bzlog pas phul du byung ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam par gcod pa tsam yin gyi bzlog pas phul du byung ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Here, the probandum is mere exclusion, not the superimposition of the opposite.

original: de nyid ni gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: This is clarified by “abiding as the nature of one, etc.”

original: cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
analyzed: cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
translated: Because sound, etc., are not simultaneous causes.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rgyu nam mkha' de gal te rtag par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyu rtag tu nye ba'i phyir cig car sgra rnams skye bar 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rgyu nam mkha' de gal te rtag par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyu rtag tu nye ba'i phyir cig car sgra rnams skye bar 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If that permanent space, which is the cause of sound, were permanent, then because the cause would always be present, sounds would be produced simultaneously. But that is not the case.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyogs rnams cig car shar la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir la dus kyang cig car dang yun ring po'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyogs rnams cig car shar la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir la dus kyang cig car dang yun ring po'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term “etc.” includes the directions, because they are not the cause of the cognition of east, etc., simultaneously, and time, because it is not the cause of the cognition of simultaneity and duration.

original: gtan tshigs @269a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs @269a * //
translated: The reason is🔽

original: kyang rnam par gcod pa tsam yin gyi rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa ma yin te nam mkha' la sogs par dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa la ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang rnam par gcod pa tsam yin gyi rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa ma yin te nam mkha' la sogs par dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa la ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is also a mere exclusion, not a gradual producer of effects, because it is not established in space, etc., which are not entities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba smos so //🔽mkha' sogs chos can dngos med kyi //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba smos so // mkha' sogs chos can dngos med kyi //
translated: For that very reason, it is called a reason with the nature of exclusion.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang de dang 'dra //
translated: The nature of non-entities such as space, etc., is also like that.

original: zhes bya ba la nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa min par yang gtan tshigs 'dis sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa min par yang gtan tshigs 'dis sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that this reason also proves that the subject, space, etc., is not of the nature of an entity.

original: de nyid ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do ;
analyzed: de nyid ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do ;
translated: That very [reason] is explained by The nature of space, etc., as subjects is not of the nature of an entity, and so on.

original: / gal te ji ltar na /
analyzed: / gal te ji ltar na /
translated: If so, how is it that:

original: cig car sgra sogs rgyu med phyir //
analyzed: cig car sgra sogs rgyu med phyir //
translated: Sound, etc., are simultaneous because they are causeless?

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that this reason proves the nonexistence of the existent,

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar cig car sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa da ltar rim gyis kyang sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar cig car sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa da ltar rim gyis kyang sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: we reply: Why is it not accepted that just as it is not a cause of sound, etc., simultaneously, it is not a cause of sound, etc., successively?

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa yang mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa yang mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted that space, etc., are permanent.🔽Therefore, the meaning of the reason is just this: it is contradictory for something to be both existent and not to function either simultaneously or successively.🔽The meaning of the reason is not unestablished, that is, it is not the case that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de bas na don gyis rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don 'di nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don gyis rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don 'di nyid du gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: yon tan med dang byed pa de dag gang la med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: phra mo de nyid rdul phran cha gsum pa la sogs pa chen po nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //

original: // 'o na ci yin zhe na /

translated: because the synonyms of “object of knowledge” are “object of proof.”🔽The passage is not about anything other than the means of knowledge, because the five members are stated in the passage in order to demonstrate the means of knowledge.

translated: The five members are established by the passage, not the others.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni byed pa ste 'dis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni byed pa ste 'dis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The proof is the means of knowledge, because it is the means of establishing that.

original: rnam par gzhag pa dag yin zhing zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa dag yin zhing zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: “The established doctrines” means the unmixed.

original: byed pa po ches shin tu 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid stobs dang ldan par @272b byed pa'i //
analyzed: byed pa po ches shin tu 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid stobs dang ldan par @272b byed pa'i //
translated: “The very desirable agent” means the one who acts with the greatest strength from the very beginning.

original: grub pa'i mtha' yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The second reply is the one beginning with “The philosophical systems are of four kinds.”

original: thams cad kyi da ltar ba'i yul ni rgyud thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi da ltar ba'i yul ni rgyud thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The present object of all is the philosophical system of all the streams.

original: de skad du rgyud thams cad dang 'gal ba med pa rgyud kyi skabs kyi don ni rgyud thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: de skad du rgyud thams cad dang 'gal ba med pa rgyud kyi skabs kyi don ni rgyud thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: The sutra says, “The meaning of the context of the tantra is the philosophical system of all the tantras, which is not in conflict with any of the tantras.”

original: rgyud mthun pa la grub cing gzhan gyi rgyud la ma grub pa ni rgol ba'i rgyud kyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: rgyud mthun pa la grub cing gzhan gyi rgyud la ma grub pa ni rgol ba'i rgyud kyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The philosophical system of the opponent is that which is established in one’s own stream of consciousness but not in the stream of consciousness of others.

original: gang grub pa na gnas skabs gzhan grub pa ni skabs kyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gang grub pa na gnas skabs gzhan grub pa ni skabs kyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The philosophical system of the context is that which is established when a certain point is established.

original: ma brtags par khas blangs pa las /
analyzed: ma brtags par khas blangs pa las /
translated: The philosophical system of the world is that which is accepted without analysis.

original: de'i khyad par brtags pa ni khas blangs pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o /
analyzed: de'i khyad par brtags pa ni khas blangs pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o /
translated: The examination of its features is the philosophical tenet system that is accepted.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /🔽bam po drug cu rtsa gsum pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad / bam po drug cu rtsa gsum pa /
translated: The examination of its distinctions is the philosophical tenet that is accepted.

original: khas blangs pa'i don ma brtags par mdor sbyar ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i don ma brtags par mdor sbyar ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The general definition of a philosophical tenet is: a philosophical tenet is a concise application that does not examine the meaning that is accepted.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa de'i tshe khas mi len pa de bas na grub pa'i mthar gyur pa ma yin pa de dag la ma grub pa nyid du thal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa de'i tshe khas mi len pa de bas na grub pa'i mthar gyur pa ma yin pa de dag la ma grub pa nyid du thal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: When the reason is not established, it is not accepted. Therefore, it is thought that the consequence of not being established does not exist for those who are not engaged in a philosophical tenet.

original: de skabs su byas nas zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de skabs su byas nas zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Having made that the occasion is a philosophical tenet.

original: dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan gsum pa yin no //
translated: The thesis, reason, example, application, and so on are the third reply.

original: de la 'dir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni las yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ltar bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni las la byed pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni las yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ltar bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni las la byed pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The object is the object-condition of the activity.

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de las yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de las yin zhing /
translated: Because that which is to be established is the object,

original: ma grub pa yang bsgrub par bya ba yin la ma grub pa de la yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang bsgrub par bya ba yin la ma grub pa de la yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang yod pa yin no //
translated: and that which is not established is to be established, and that which is not established also exists in some way as the reason, etc.

original: de ni rnam pa 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is stated in the verse beginning with “that.”

original: de ltar na sgrub par byed pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas las nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na sgrub par byed pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas las nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the proof is also shown to be the object in the manner explained.

original: byed pa po chos shin tu 'dod pa las yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po chos shin tu 'dod pa las yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which was explained as “the agent is the object of the desire for dharma,” etc., is also unreasonable.

original: 'di ltar de la 'das pa'i dus brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la 'das pa'i dus brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the past time is not intended to be stated here.

original: 'dod pa dang 'dod par 'gyur ba la yang las kyi ming can du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang 'dod par 'gyur ba la yang las kyi ming can du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the name of the action is accepted in the sense of that which is to be accomplished and that which is to be made.

original: de lta ma yin na grong du song zhes bya ba 'di nyid la las kyi ming can du 'gyur gyi grong du 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'gyur ro //🔽de nyid bstan @273a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na grong du song zhes bya ba 'di nyid la las kyi ming can du 'gyur gyi grong du 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'gyur ro // de nyid bstan @273a * //
translated: Otherwise, the name of the action would be in the expression “he goes to the village,” but not in the expression “he goes to the village” and “he will go.”

original: par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “that which is to be accomplished, etc.”🔽The phrase “etc.” includes the occasion of the philosophical position, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni grub pa'i mtha'i skabs la sogs pa gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa gang yin pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni grub pa'i mtha'i skabs la sogs pa gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa gang yin pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “etc.” includes the four kinds of philosophical positions, etc., which were previously explained.

original: ji ltar 'di la nus pa med pa de ltar 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la nus pa med pa de ltar 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How it is that this is not possible will be explained later.

translated: “Because the nature is not established previously” means that if the established entity that is to be established from the characteristics of the parts were different from the proof, then this response would be tenable.

original: rgol ba gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par la rmongs pa de yan lag gi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i phyir bstan par bya ba yin no //

translated: The one who argues, confused about the distinction between the probandum and the proof, is taught for the sake of stating the characteristics of the parts.

original: de nyid ni rgol ba gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni rgol ba gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That is stated by “the one who argues” and so on.

original: sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dbye ba ma bzung ba can gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa ldog pa don can gyi sgra las bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dbye ba ma bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dbye ba ma bzung ba can gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa ldog pa don can gyi sgra las bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dbye ba ma bzung ba yin te /
translated: “Not apprehending the distinction between the probandum and the proof” means that from the words that have the purpose of reversing the nonestablished probandum, the distinction between the probandum and the proof is not apprehended,

original: sgrub par byed pa la yang ma grub pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la yang ma grub pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proof also has a nonestablished property.

original: khas blangs mtshan nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni ji lta ji ltar khas blangs pa nyid grub pa'i mtha'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs mtshan nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni ji lta ji ltar khas blangs pa nyid grub pa'i mtha'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of the definition of the thesis” means that the thesis is expressed by the term “philosophical theory.”🔽“We agree” means that the meaning of the thesis is philosophical theory.

original: 'gyur bar na 'dod mod kyi khas blangs pa'i don ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa ma grub pa de'i tshe de'i ngo bor khas blangs pa yin no zhe na /

translated: But when the reason and so on are not established, then the thesis is accepted as having that nature.

original: de'i phyir gal te yang ma grub pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te yang ma grub pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, if you say that the reason and so on are not established, then the thesis is not established.

translated: The explanation of the conditions of the agent itself establishes the thesis.

translated: The idea is this: The terms thesis, acceptance, and philosophical theory are presented as synonyms. In that case, this is our philosophical theory.

analyzed: 'di ni kho bo cag gi dam bca' ba yin zhing 'di ni khas blangs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //

translated: Thus, as long as the probandum is expressed by the word, for that long the thesis, the assertion, and the conclusion are the objects of verbal expression, and the word probandum also implicates the three.
