original: de dag dang 'brel pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni blo dang 'brel pa can yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni blo dang 'brel pa can yin no //
translated: It is connected with them means it is connected with the cognitions.

original: gzhan yang mnyan bya nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba'i phyir 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du srog la sogs pa yang zhes ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: gzhan yang mnyan bya nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba'i phyir 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du srog la sogs pa yang zhes ba'i tha tshig go
translated: Moreover, with respect to what is said in the lines beginning “Moreover, the object of hearing, etc.,” just as the object of hearing is mistaken because one doubts whether it is or is not concomitant with the object of hearing, so too is the life faculty, etc.

original: // srog la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa nyid las ldog par 'gyur gyi mthun pa'i phyogs dag las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: // srog la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa nyid las ldog par 'gyur gyi mthun pa'i phyogs dag las ni ma yin no //
translated: The life faculty, etc., are discordant with the absence of self in such things as pots, but they are not discordant with things that have a self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “For, in the absence of something, etc.”

original: gang las ldog pa gzhan gyis bdag dang bcas par cung zad kyang khas blangs pa yod pa ma yin te med pa la bral ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las ldog pa gzhan gyis bdag dang bcas par cung zad kyang khas blangs pa yod pa ma yin te med pa la bral ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is not the slightest assertion that something is endowed with a self that is discordant with something else, because it is not possible to be separated from what is nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa bdag las ldog pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i dogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'di'i ldog pa 'khrul pa med pa can yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa bdag las ldog pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i dogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'di'i ldog pa 'khrul pa med pa can yin no //
translated: Because life force, etc. are not excluded from the self, therefore there is no possibility of their being included in the non-self. Thus, its exclusion is non-erroneous.

original: 'on kyang mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las kyang zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa nyid las ldog pa de bas na dngos po'i chos su gyur pa 'di la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang 'jug pa'i dogs pa mi ldog pa
analyzed: 'on kyang mthun pa'i phyogs nyid las kyang zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa nyid las ldog pa de bas na dngos po'i chos su gyur pa 'di la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang 'jug pa'i dogs pa mi ldog pa
translated: But even from the similar class, i.e. from the similar class of permanence, it is excluded. Therefore, since there is no other possibility for this which is a property of an entity, the possibility of its being included in the dissimilar class is also excluded.

original: de ltar na ldog pa la 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ldog pa la 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: Thus, its exclusion is non-erroneous.

original: ldog pa gzhan ma yin zhing rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid de las ldog pa yin zhing ldog pa med pa yang rjes su 'gro ba
analyzed: ldog pa gzhan ma yin zhing rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid de las ldog pa yin zhing ldog pa med pa yang rjes su 'gro ba
translated: The absence of exclusion is not different from the absence of pervasion, and the absence of pervasion is not different from the absence of exclusion. That which is the absence of pervasion in the similar class is itself the exclusion from that. And the absence of exclusion is the pervasion in the dissimilar class.

original: yin te / dgag pa 'gog pa ni sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / dgag pa 'gog pa ni sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of negation is the nature of affirmation.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la med pa ni rtag pa'i yul ma yin zhing mi rtag pa'i yul yang ma yin pa de ltar mi rtag pa'i yul yang rtag pa'i yul ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi yang gcig gi @279a * //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la med pa ni rtag pa'i yul ma yin zhing mi rtag pa'i yul yang ma yin pa de ltar mi rtag pa'i yul yang rtag pa'i yul ma yin no // de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi yang gcig gi @279a * //
translated: As for the phrase “neither permanent nor impermanent,” etc., nonexistence is not the object of permanence, nor is it the object of impermanence; and likewise, the object of impermanence is not the object of permanence.

original: yul ma yin pa yang gzhan gyi yul du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa yang gzhan gyi yul du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Similarly, neither the object of pervasion nor the object of non-pervasion is the object of the other. This is the summarized meaning.

original: ma yin te de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: ma yin te de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: No, because they are the same, etc.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa de dag ni dngos po nyid kyi de nyid mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa de dag ni dngos po nyid kyi de nyid mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reply is that permanence and impermanence are the characteristics of the reality of things themselves,

original: gcig 'gog pa'i gnyis bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig 'gog pa'i gnyis bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristic of one is the negation of the other.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du rtag pa med pa tsam rtag pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dag ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du rtag pa med pa tsam rtag pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dag ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: The mere absence of permanence is not permanence, but rather, those are the intrinsic reality of things.

original: de bas na de dag dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dag gcig med pa'i yul gyi dngos po de las gzhan pa yul du 'gyur ba yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de dag dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dag gcig med pa'i yul gyi dngos po de las gzhan pa yul du 'gyur ba yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, since those are the intrinsic reality of things, they are the objects of the absence of one another, and the object of the absence of one thing is the other thing, but it is not nonexistence.

original: de nyid ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽rjes su 'gro ba med pa tsam ni ldog pa yin la de rjes su 'gro ba med na gdon mi za yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rjes su 'gro ba med pa tsam ni ldog pa yin la de rjes su 'gro ba med na gdon mi za yod pa yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “Because that is the intrinsic reality of things, etc.”🔽The mere absence of concomitance is the counter-correlate, and if that is absent, then without a doubt, it is existent.

original: med pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ni grub pa yin la de med pa 'gog par mi 'dod par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ni grub pa yin la de med pa 'gog par mi 'dod par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristic of the negation of nonexistence is establishment, and if that is not accepted as the negation of nonexistence, then it is obtained.

original: de la yang rnam par gcod pa tsam brjod par 'dod pa yod na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mi rtag pa nyid med pa tsam rtag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin pa de'i tshe dngos po ma yin pa
analyzed: de la yang rnam par gcod pa tsam brjod par 'dod pa yod na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mi rtag pa nyid med pa tsam rtag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin pa de'i tshe dngos po ma yin pa
translated: If one wishes to state only the exclusion, then when one wishes to state permanence as the mere absence of impermanence, but not as a positive phenomenon, then the exclusion of that, i.e., impermanence, is the characteristic of the non-existent.

original: bkag pa la yang de'i mtshan nyid yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig gi yul ma yin pa de las gzhan pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: bkag pa la yang de'i mtshan nyid yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig gi yul ma yin pa de las gzhan pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: And in the negation, the characteristic of that, i.e., the existent, is the characteristic of the object of that which is different from the object of the permanent and the impermanent.

original: med pa'i sgra nyid ni dgag pa rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i sgra nyid ni dgag pa rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “non-existent” itself expresses negation.

original: de ltar na dngos por gyur ba'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la las gtan tshigs ldog pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs med pa la ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos por gyur ba'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la las gtan tshigs ldog pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs med pa la ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, when there is no similar instance, i.e., when there is no positive phenomenon, the reason “being a thing” and so on, is shown to be inconclusive.

original: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ba'o //
translated: “Others” refers to the Buddhists.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa rtag pa las gtan tshigs byas pa ldog par smra ba la rigs pa ma yin pa byed par bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa rtag pa las gtan tshigs byas pa ldog par smra ba la rigs pa ma yin pa byed par bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be thought that it is illogical to state that the reason “being a product” is excluded from the permanent, which is the dissimilar class.

original: dngos po la reg pa med pa ste sangs rgyas pas mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgag pa gang yin par brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la reg pa med pa ste sangs rgyas pas mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgag pa gang yin par brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The exclusion that is stated to have the characteristic of exclusion from the dissimilar class and the similar class is not in contact with an entity.

original: rnam par bcad las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par bcad las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not different from the negation. This is the meaning.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par gcod pa'i rgyus rnam par gcod pa nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i chos gzhan dngos po'i khyad par 'gog pa ste ma yin par zhes bya ba'i tha @279b tshig go //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par gcod pa'i rgyus rnam par gcod pa nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i chos gzhan dngos po'i khyad par 'gog pa ste ma yin par zhes bya ba'i tha @279b tshig go //
translated: If, on the other hand, the exclusion is indicated by the cause of exclusion, then another property, a particular entity, is excluded, that is, is not. This is the meaning.

original: skabs su bab pa'i sgrub par byad pa zhes bya ba byas pa nyid de sgrub par byed pa'i chos ldog na'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i sgrub par byad pa zhes bya ba byas pa nyid de sgrub par byed pa'i chos ldog na'o //
translated: The property to be established in the present context is “being a product.” When the property that establishes that is excluded,

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi sgra'i 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi gzhung gis sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis sgra'i 'jug pa gang yin pa de med pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi sgra'i 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi gzhung gis sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis sgra'i 'jug pa gang yin pa de med pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that there is no engagement of the terms “affirmation” and “negation” in the case of non-existents.

original: ma yin par dgag pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa yang ma yin pa dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir med par mi 'dod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa yang ma yin pa dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir med par mi 'dod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: “Nor are they of the nature of absolute negation” means that they are not even absolute negations, because the nature of things is not non-existence.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni med pa de'i yang yul dgag pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni med pa de'i yang yul dgag pa ni bla ste /
translated: “In that case,” means that it is better to negate the object of that non-existence.

original: ma yin pa'i yul ma yin zhing med pa dgag pa'i yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i yul ma yin zhing med pa dgag pa'i yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the object of a non-existent, nor is it the object of an absolute negation.

original: yul dus 'gog ces bya ba ni med pa dgag pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang yul dang dus yod pa nyid 'di la med cing dus 'dir med do zhes 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: yul dus 'gog ces bya ba ni med pa dgag pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang yul dang dus yod pa nyid 'di la med cing dus 'dir med do zhes 'gog pa yin no //
translated: “Negation of place and time” means that it is not an absolute negation, but rather a negation that says “It does not exist in this place and time.”

original: gal te de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: If it were so, etc. is the introduction to the opponent's doubt.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa'o //
translated: The existent is the existent entity.

original: du ma dgag sgrub bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad pa'i chos dag gi dgag pa dang sgrub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du ma dgag sgrub bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad pa'i chos dag gi dgag pa dang sgrub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Like the negation and affirmation of the many, etc. means like the negation and affirmation of the dharmas that have different bases.

original: rna ba la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not being the effect of the ear, etc. means not being the effect of the visual consciousness.

original: bslad pa zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bslad pa zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams kyis so //
translated: Corrupted means by the sounds.

original: mi shes bslad can zhes bya ba ni mi shes pas 'khrul pa can no //
analyzed: mi shes bslad can zhes bya ba ni mi shes pas 'khrul pa can no //
translated: Corrupted by ignorance means deluded by ignorance.

original: de nyid ni rnam pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te rnam pa mi shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rnam pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te rnam pa mi shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is called not knowing the aspects, etc. That is said to be so if it has not known the aspects.

original: dngos po tha dad pa la brten pas 'jug pa gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa la brten pas 'jug pa gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word exists is to be supplied to each of the terms.

original: de nas khyad par gyi bsdu ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khyad par gyi bsdu ba bya'o //
translated: Then the special inclusion is to be stated.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po tha dad pa la brten pas 'jug pa de'i phyir zhen pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi mi shes pas bslad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po tha dad pa la brten pas 'jug pa de'i phyir zhen pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi mi shes pas bslad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it operates in dependence upon different things, it is the nature of adherence, because it is polluted by ignorance.

original: 'dis kyang mi shes bslad pa can zhes bya ba bstan to //🔽'brel pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan gyi don gyi ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang de mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dis kyang mi shes bslad pa can zhes bya ba bstan to // 'brel pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan gyi don gyi ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang de mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa dag go //
translated: This also shows what is meant by polluted by ignorance.🔽The words if there is a connection and so on refer to the words whatever is an inference for the benefit of another is impermanent.

original: de ston par byed pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag gi rtog pa'i don du don khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag gi rtog pa'i don du don khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words in the context of teaching that and so on mean that the words whatever is an inference for the benefit of another is impermanent are accepted as the meaning of the expression whatever is an inference for the benefit of another is impermanent in order to make it understandable to others.

original: tshad ma dang cig shos 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang cig shos 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because valid cognition and its opposite are mutually exclusive.

original: med pa sgrub par byed pa dang yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa sgrub par byed pa dang yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction between the valid cognitions that prove nonexistence and those that prove existence.

original: yul gcig la 'jug pa na 'gal bar @280a * //
analyzed: yul gcig la 'jug pa na 'gal bar @280a * //
translated: If they were to engage the same object, they would be contradictory.

original: 'gyur gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i tshad ma 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i tshad ma 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But valid cognitions that engage their objects by the power of things are not contradictory.

original: des byas pa'i go bar byed pa dgag pa'i rten mthun pa'i phyogs de la tha tshom za ba'i phyir ro //🔽bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pas bdag med pa dag la zhes bshad pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na bdag rang bzhin gyis bskal pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na bum pa
analyzed: des byas pa'i go bar byed pa dgag pa'i rten mthun pa'i phyogs de la tha tshom za ba'i phyir ro // bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pas bdag med pa dag la zhes bshad pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na bdag rang bzhin gyis bskal pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na bum pa
translated: Because there is doubt about the concordant side, which is the basis for the negation that is produced by that.

original: la sogs pa dag la yang med pa yin /
analyzed: la sogs pa dag la yang med pa yin /
translated: With regard to some non-self of a pot, etc., the phrase “not seeing” is explained by the thought of another as “not seeing in selflessness.” Otherwise, since the self is naturally isolated, how could it not exist in a pot, etc.?

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa mdun na gnas pa bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba de ltar na yang ma mthong ba de la yang ji ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ldog pa dngos
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa mdun na gnas pa bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba de ltar na yang ma mthong ba de la yang ji ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ldog pa dngos
translated: If a pot, etc. that is present in front of one is not seen to have life, etc. that is devoid of self, then how could the pot, etc. that is characterized by being perceived be reversed?

original: po bdag med par gzhag pa ma mthong bdag la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po bdag med par gzhag pa ma mthong bdag la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-seeing of the selflessness of things is doubted.

original: de yod na ni der 'gyur na //
analyzed: de yod na ni der 'gyur na //
translated: If it exists, it would be that.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po phung po gsum pa yod par 'gyur na gang la bdag med pa ldog pa na yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa de dang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po phung po gsum pa yod par 'gyur na gang la bdag med pa ldog pa na yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa de dang der 'gyur ro //
translated: If the third alternative of a thing existed, then it would be that, where the reversal of selflessness is also the existence of self.

original: gson po'i lus la bdag med pa ldog pa na yang bdag gi dngos po yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gson po'i lus la bdag med pa ldog pa na yang bdag gi dngos po yod pa yin no //
translated: When the reversal of selflessness in the body of a living being, the existence of the thing that is self would also exist.

original: 'on kyang yod pa ldog pa med na yang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs su brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa ldog pa med na yang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs su brjod pa yin te /
translated: But if existence is not reversed, then how is it that life, etc. are stated to be the concordant class that is not reversed?

original: srog la sogs pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog pa na med pa la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog pa na med pa la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no reversal of that which does not exist.

original: de ltar na yang srog la sogs pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang srog la sogs pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: But even so, the existence of the favorable side of life, etc., is not demonstrated.

original: gal te ldog med rjes 'gro med //
analyzed: gal te ldog med rjes 'gro med //
translated: If there is no reversal, there is no forward movement.

original: ces bya ba ni gal te mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa dang bral ba yin na yang rjes su 'gro bar mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa dang bral ba yin na yang rjes su 'gro bar mi 'dod na'o //
translated: If there is no reversal from the favorable side, and if there is no absence of the unfavorable side, then there is no forward movement.

original: mthong ba dang mthong ba de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid de'i sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang mthong ba de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid de'i sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: The seeing and the seen are the proof of the existence of the cause and effect, and so they are designated as such.

original: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa la sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya ba nges pa la sgrub par byed pa nges pa'i rnam par nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa la sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya ba nges pa la sgrub par byed pa nges pa'i rnam par nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the case of the statement, “The proof is ascertained when the probandum is ascertained,” the proof is not ascertained when the probandum is ascertained,

original: thams cad thams cad la sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad la sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because everything would be connected with everything else.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nges pa med par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nges pa med par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that it is not indefinite.

original: 'di'i tha dad byed tha dad min //
analyzed: 'di'i tha dad byed tha dad min //
translated: It is different from it, and not different from it.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni bdun pa'i tshig gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni bdun pa'i tshig gcig pa yin no //
translated: Here, the word “it” is the same as the seventh case.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: “From it” means “from the collection.”

original: 'dis ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: This is the anticipation of the opponent’s objection.

original: 'dir 'di'i bsam pa ni gal te yang me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las du ba skye ba de lta na yang brgya byin gyi spyi bo la @280b sogs pa las kyang 'byung ba yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'di'i bsam pa ni gal te yang me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las du ba skye ba de lta na yang brgya byin gyi spyi bo la @280b sogs pa las kyang 'byung ba yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The opponent’s idea is this: “Even though smoke arises from the collection of fire, etc., it exists in the collection of Indra’s forehead, etc.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the following argument is presented:

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las nges par skye ba can gyi du ba ci ltar mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i tshogs pa las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las nges par skye ba can gyi du ba ci ltar mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i tshogs pa las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “How can smoke, which definitely arises from the collection of fire, etc., arise from a collection that lacks the characteristics of that collection?”

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir me la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de tha dad par byed pa dang tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo gang gis me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas du ba skyed par byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de tha dad par byed pa dang tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo gang gis me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas du ba skyed par byed /
translated: Because any collection that is devoid of the characteristics of fire, etc., is not a different entity from that which is the producer of fire, etc., and that which is not the producer of fire, etc.🔽How could a collection of fire, etc. generate smoke?

original: de ni mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the same, it is not a different producer.

original: de bas na tshogs pa gzhan la rag las pa ci ltar tshogs pa gzhan las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur na 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshogs pa gzhan la rag las pa ci ltar tshogs pa gzhan las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur na 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, how could the other collection be dependent on another collection? If it were to arise, then this fault would exist: the effect would be without a cause.

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo tha dad pa med pa de bas na me las kyang du ba 'byung ba yod pa de ltar na 'bras bu'i rgyu 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo tha dad pa med pa de bas na me las kyang du ba 'byung ba yod pa de ltar na 'bras bu'i rgyu 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because there is no difference in entity, therefore, just as smoke arises from fire, in the same way, the cause of the effect is not mistaken.

original: de ltar na tha dad par byed pa dang tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa las len na tha dad pa'i ngo bo /
analyzed: de ltar na tha dad par byed pa dang tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa las len na tha dad pa'i ngo bo /
translated: Thus, if you accept that it is different from that which is different from it, then it would be different from that which is not different from it.🔽

original: ngo bo tha dad med nyid nyams //
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad med nyid nyams //
translated: Thus, if you accept that there is a difference or that there is no difference, then the difference or non-difference of nature is contradicted.

original: dngos po gcig la zhes bya ba ni lan gyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la zhes bya ba ni lan gyi tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase “in one thing” is the answer.

original: de nyid ni de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that “in that case, smoke, etc.”

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i tshogs pa ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa ni rang bzhin can no //🔽ji ltar me las dngos su 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon sum ste /🔽me'i yul can gyi mngon sum gyi shes pa yul can yin te me ni du ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i tshogs pa ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa ni rang bzhin can no // ji ltar me las dngos su 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon sum ste / me'i yul can gyi mngon sum gyi shes pa yul can yin te me ni du ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection of different things, such as Śakra’s head, etc., is natural.🔽“Direct perception, etc.” is direct perception.🔽The direct perception of fire is the object of the cognition of fire, because fire is the cause of smoke.

original: rgyu de yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni du ba'i rgyu ni me yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni du ba'i rgyu ni me yin te /
translated: “That is understood to be the cause” means that fire is the cause of smoke, because smoke is the effect of fire.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis slu ba med par rtogs pa de ltar rjes su dpag pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis slu ba med par rtogs pa de ltar rjes su dpag pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: Just as perception is understood to be nondeceptive, so also is inference.

original: de dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas //
translated: The substance that is related to it

original: zhes bya ba ni 'o ma dang 'brel pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'o ma dang 'brel pa'i rdzas so //
translated: is the substance related to milk.

original: ci ste 'bras bu rul pa'i spyi la brten nas zhes bya ba ni rul pa tha dad pa la yang gcig nyid du zhe pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu rul pa'i spyi la brten nas zhes bya ba ni rul pa tha dad pa la yang gcig nyid du zhe pa'o //
translated: If you say that the result is based on the universal of rottenness, then even though rottenness is different, it is still the same.

original: gcig nyid yin zhes bya ba ni nus pa dag la yang gcig nyid du zhen nas gcig nyid kyi tha snyad la brten pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin zhes bya ba ni nus pa dag la yang gcig nyid du zhen nas gcig nyid kyi tha snyad la brten pa yin par brjod do //
translated: If you say that it is the same, then you are still clinging to the idea that the potencies are the same, and you are still relying on the convention of sameness.

original: de kho na nyid du rdzas ni bdag phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir nus pa rdzas bzhin du tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du rdzas ni bdag phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir nus pa rdzas bzhin du tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: In reality, the substance is characterized by the excellence of the self, and therefore the potencies are different from the substance.

original: de nyid ni rgol ba sngon du song bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni rgol ba sngon du song bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this very point, he says:

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'di bdag ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @281a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'di bdag ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @281a * //
translated: “This is so, but what is this self?”

original: so ; / bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nus pa dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun 'dres pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: so ; / bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nus pa dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun 'dres pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word own is to be supplied with both nature and power. The meaning is: the power and effect that have the nature of entities are not mixed with each other.

original: gcig po des zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gcig po des zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The word that is to be supplied with one.🔽The word basis is to be supplied with of the component thing.

original: yan lag gi dngos po'i rten zhes bya ba ni du ba dang bud shing gi 'gyur ba la yan lag ste rgyu nyid kyi dngos po'i rten yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gi dngos po'i rten zhes bya ba ni du ba dang bud shing gi 'gyur ba la yan lag ste rgyu nyid kyi dngos po'i rten yin no //
translated: The word destroyed is to be supplied with impermanent.

original: 'jig dang byas pa nyid gong du ji skad bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'jig dang byas pa nyid gong du ji skad bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The word made is to be supplied with produced.🔽The word that is to be supplied with impermanent.

original: gang dag de go bar byed pa yin par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni mnyan par bya ba nyid dang mtshungs pa'i ldog pa rgol ba gang dag go par byed pa nyid du mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gang dag de go bar byed pa yin par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni mnyan par bya ba nyid dang mtshungs pa'i ldog pa rgol ba gang dag go par byed pa nyid du mi 'dod kyi /
translated: The word that is to be supplied with produced.

original: srog la sogs pa mnyan par bya ba nyid dang mtshungs pa'i chos can go bar byed pa nyid yin par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa mnyan par bya ba nyid dang mtshungs pa'i chos can go bar byed pa nyid yin par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The property of the subject is understood to be the same as the property to be proved.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin dben pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas de med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin dben pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas de med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in the reason based on nature, because it proves the existence of the property to be proved, which is the nature of being suitable as the referent of the expression of the absence of that.

original: brgyud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pas na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba med par ston par byed do //
analyzed: brgyud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pas na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba med par ston par byed do //
translated: In the case of the indirect reason, the absence of the effect and the absence of the pervader are shown by the absence of the cause and the absence of the pervader, respectively.

original: de la yang rang bzhin 'gog pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rang bzhin 'gog pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, because it negates the nature, it is included in the reason based on nature, in the manner that has been explained.

original: de la yang skyes bu ma mthong las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi phyir skyes bu ma mthong ba de'i phyir skyes bu ma mthong ba'i rgyus skyes bu ldog pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang skyes bu ma mthong las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi phyir skyes bu ma mthong ba de'i phyir skyes bu ma mthong ba'i rgyus skyes bu ldog pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, because a person is not seen and so on. Since a person is not seen, therefore, because of the non-seeing of a person, the reversal of a person exists, and the reversal of life-force and so on does not exist.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir skyes bu ma mthong ba de'i phyir de ldog pas srog la sogs pa ldog par nges par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir skyes bu ma mthong ba de'i phyir de ldog pas srog la sogs pa ldog par nges par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is stated as follows: Because a person is not seen, therefore, because of the reversal of that, the reversal of life-force and so on is ascertained to not exist.

original: don 'di ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rigs pa brtags pa logs shig tu mdzad pa las bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rigs pa brtags pa logs shig tu mdzad pa las bshad pa yin no //
translated: This meaning is explained in the separate treatise Examination of Reasoning composed by Master Dignaga.

original: gzhung gang gis she na /
analyzed: gzhung gang gis she na /
translated: By what text?

original: gzhan la ma mthong ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan la ma mthong ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, By 'because of the non-seeing of an essence in another' and so on.

original: slob dpon gyi gzhung 'dis ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gzhung 'dis ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa yin no //
translated: This treatise of the master explains that a reason with reversal is a reason with doubt.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi snang ba'i yul mi dmigs pa la yang the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba rtogs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi snang ba'i yul mi dmigs pa la yang the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that even in the case of non-perception of an imperceptible object, there is doubt.

original: de bas na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid kyi khyad par slob dpon bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid kyi khyad par slob dpon bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the master accepts the distinction that the definition of perception is just that.

original: las la yod pa'am zhes bya ba ni las sgrub par byed pa la dmigs pa'i sgras las kyi bya ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: las la yod pa'am zhes bya ba ni las sgrub par byed pa la dmigs pa'i sgras las kyi bya ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: As for the phrase “in the case of an existent object,” the word “object” refers to the object of the act of perception, and the word “act” refers to the act of perception.

original: byed pa bsgrub pa ni byed pa po la @281b yod pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa bsgrub pa ni byed pa po la @281b yod pa yin no //
translated: The act of perception is in the agent.

original: khyab pa dang ldog pa mad pa ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de 'dra ba'i don ni gang dang gang la de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de dang de la de 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni khyab🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa dang ldog pa mad pa ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de 'dra ba'i don ni gang dang gang la de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de dang de la de 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni khyab pa yin no //
translated: The pervasion and the counter-pervasion are as follows: The meaning of the definition of perception is that whatever has such a nature is perceived by that, and that is called perception. This is the pervasion.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa yang na yul med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa yang na yul med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med pa yin no //
translated: And the knowledge that has such a nature is not without an object. This is the counter-pervasion.

original: yul can dag ces bya ba ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: yul can dag ces bya ba ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The subject is said to be non-existent, which is a negative expression.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: And that non-apprehension is said to be non-apprehension of non-existence,

original: dmigs pa'i sgras blos brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgras blos brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word “apprehension” refers to cognition.

original: med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni dgag pa las zlog pa yod pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni dgag pa las zlog pa yod pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is the nature of non-existence itself, because it is the opposite of negation, it is the nature of existence itself. Therefore, it is said to be the nature of non-existence.

original: shes brjod the tshom za ba'i zhes bya ba ni gcig bzhon du 'gyur ba'i zlas dbye bas ma ning gi rtags yin no //
analyzed: shes brjod the tshom za ba'i zhes bya ba ni gcig bzhon du 'gyur ba'i zlas dbye bas ma ning gi rtags yin no //
translated: The word “doubt” is a neuter word formed by the compound “doubtful about cognition and expression.”

original: de nyid yul can dag yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yul can dag yin no //
translated: That is the subject.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig gsum pa can gyi zlas dbye ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig gsum pa can gyi zlas dbye ba yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that the compound “existence of cognition” is a three-word compound.

original: 'di gnyis las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las yul can la yul bstan pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'di gnyis las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las yul can la yul bstan pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gzung ngo //
translated: “From these two” means that from the seen and the unseen, the object is indicated to the subject. Thus, the forward and reverse pervasion are grasped.

original: med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni med pa'i sgra la sogs par rung ba de nyid 'bras bu grub pas na ste /
analyzed: med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni med pa'i sgra la sogs par rung ba de nyid 'bras bu grub pas na ste /
translated: “The cognition of nonexistence, etc.” The word “etc.” is applicable to the words “nonexistence,” etc. That is established as the effect.

original: rung ba de yang bdag nyid du gyur ba yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: rung ba de yang bdag nyid du gyur ba yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: That which is applicable is itself the nature. Thus, it is included within the reason of nature.

original: dgos pa gang gis nyams su myong ba ste bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni shes pa ni rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin gyi 'di'i shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes de bstan par
analyzed: dgos pa gang gis nyams su myong ba ste bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni shes pa ni rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin gyi 'di'i shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes de bstan par
translated: “For what purpose is it experienced?” This is the summarized meaning: “Consciousness is itself the nature of reflexive awareness. Its consciousness is not experienced by another.” In order to demonstrate that,

original: bya ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba smos pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba smos pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “experience” is mentioned.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul las yul gzhan gyis nye bar bsgyur ba gzhan dang 'dres pa can te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul las yul gzhan gyis nye bar bsgyur ba gzhan dang 'dres pa can te /
translated: The object of expression is mixed with another object, which is different from it.

original: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe tha dad pa shes pa 'di'i shes pa 'di las tha dad pa yin no zhes 'di rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe tha dad pa shes pa 'di'i shes pa 'di las tha dad pa yin no zhes 'di rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it appears in the nature of self-awareness, then it is posited as different, as in “This consciousness is different from that consciousness.”

original: dper na gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a cloth that is dyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na gos la tshon gzhan gyis bsgyur ba na rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir dmar por nges pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na gos la tshon gzhan gyis bsgyur ba na rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir dmar por nges pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a cloth is dyed with another color, it is not definitely red because it depends on another cause.

original: dngos po ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: A thing is a productive cause.

original: de las 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: de las 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: If it were like that,

original: dngos po rgyu las 'byung ba nyid na ste /
analyzed: dngos po rgyu las 'byung ba nyid na ste /
translated: then because a thing arises from a cause,

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: it would be impermanent.

original: de'i dngos po de la'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po de la'o //
translated: That thing is in that.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni tha @282a * //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni tha @282a * //
translated: The term “property” means difference.

original: dad pa'o // gang gis dngos po 'jig pa de nyid kyi phyir dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dad pa'o // gang gis dngos po 'jig pa de nyid kyi phyir dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because of that, the thing is destroyed. Therefore, it is called “the destruction of the thing.”

original: brgyud pa 'dis ci zhig bya ba ni dngos po'i rgyus mi rtag pa nyid tha dad pa skyed par 'gyur zhing des 'di 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyud pa 'dis ci zhig bya ba ni dngos po'i rgyus mi rtag pa nyid tha dad pa skyed par 'gyur zhing des 'di 'jig pa yin no //
translated: What does this lineage do? It causes impermanence, which is different from the thing, to arise, and that is the destruction of the thing.

original: 'jig ste zhes bya ba ni mdo yin la /
analyzed: 'jig ste zhes bya ba ni mdo yin la /
translated: “ Having been destroyed” is the sūtra.

original: de nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: “ That very thing” is explained by “impermanence, etc.”

original: cir yang mi 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: cir yang mi 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: “ Nothing at all” is the opponent’s position.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yang de yin la 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yang de yin la 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: “ Having become the nature of a thing” is a summary of the specific.

original: de byed pas na gal ta mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir chos bdag la phan 'dogs par byed par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de byed pas na gal ta mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir chos bdag la phan 'dogs par byed par yang 'gyur te /
translated: “ If it is impermanent, it would benefit the thing’s self.”

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yang phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yang phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nature of the destruction of a pot, etc. would also be a benefactor.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig par byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos su 'gyur na 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig par byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos su 'gyur na 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no //
translated: That is, if it were a phenomenon having the nature of impermanence, which is admitted to be a destroyer, it would not be anything at all.

original: 'byung 'jig can zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gang la gzhan gyis kyang 'di 'jig par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byung 'jig can zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gang la gzhan gyis kyang 'di 'jig par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which has origination and destruction is a state in which it is admitted that this is destroyed by another.

original: don dam par ni skad cig ma re re la dngos po rnams 'byung zhing 'jig pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni skad cig ma re re la dngos po rnams 'byung zhing 'jig pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the example is that things originate and are destroyed in each moment.🔽At that time:

original: de'i tshe / de ltar med yod ji ltar rung //
analyzed: de'i tshe / de ltar med yod ji ltar rung //
translated: How could it be nonexistent and existent?

original: gal te skad cig kyang ltos med //
analyzed: gal te skad cig kyang ltos med //
translated: If it were momentary and independent,

original: dngos po 'byung ba ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po 'byung ba ma yin na //
translated: things would not originate.

original: dngos po 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa nyid yin na skad cig kyang dngos po yod pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa nyid yin na skad cig kyang dngos po yod pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If destruction were independent, even a momentary existent thing would not be obtained. That is, it would not be obtained.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
translated: This is not so, etc. is the proponent of the philosophical position.🔽At that time,

original: de'i tshe / de ltar med yod ji ltar rung //
analyzed: de'i tshe / de ltar med yod ji ltar rung //
translated: how could it be that it does not exist as it is?

original: gcig la yang der 'di 'di'i yod pa dang med pa ji ltar rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig la yang der 'di 'di'i yod pa dang med pa ji ltar rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How could it be that it exists and does not exist in one?

original: de nyid ni dngos po mi rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni dngos po mi rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: This is explained by “The thing is impermanent, etc.”

original: slob dpon sh'akya blos sbyar ba las tshad ma rnam 'grel le'u bzhi pa'i t'i k'o //
analyzed: slob dpon sh'akya blos sbyar ba las tshad ma rnam 'grel le'u bzhi pa'i t'i k'o //
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter of the Pramāṇavārttika composed by the master Śākyabuddhi.

original: mu stegs brdzun pa'i rtog ge thams cad 'joms nus bstan bcos lugs bzangs thams cad kyi //
analyzed: mu stegs brdzun pa'i rtog ge thams cad 'joms nus bstan bcos lugs bzangs thams cad kyi //
translated: Capable of vanquishing all the false reasonings of the tīrthikas, this treatise is the best of all good systems.

original: cha tsam bdag gis bshad pas mi g-yo shin tu brtan pa'i bsod nams skyes thob pa //
analyzed: cha tsam bdag gis bshad pas mi g-yo shin tu brtan pa'i bsod nams skyes thob pa //
translated: Through my explanation, even a small part of it, unshakable and very stable merit is obtained.

original: des ni sems can tshogs 'di srid pa gsum pa'i rgya mtsho dag las yongs drangs nas //
analyzed: des ni sems can tshogs 'di srid pa gsum pa'i rgya mtsho dag las yongs drangs nas //
translated: By that, this assembly of sentient beings, having been completely drawn out of the ocean of the three existences,

original: tshangs sogs kyis kyang thob min sangs rgyas go 'phang dri med rtag tu thob par shog //
analyzed: tshangs sogs kyis kyang thob min sangs rgyas go 'phang dri med rtag tu thob par shog //
translated: May they always attain the stainless state of buddhahood, which is not attained even by Brahmā and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi zhabs sgom pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi zhabs sgom pa /
translated: The meditation on the feet of the Bhagavat Mañjughoṣa.

original: slob dbon sh'akya'i blos sbyar ba tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dbon sh'akya'i blos sbyar ba tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the Pramaṇavarttika composed by Ācārya Śākyabuddhi is complete.

original: // /'di ni lo ts'a ba rma dge ba'i blo gros kyis bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: // /'di ni lo ts'a ba rma dge ba'i blo gros kyis bsgyur ba'o /
translated: This was translated by the translator Ma Géwé Lodrö.
